dataList.content: <So that thing behind him is...>
Indeed, that is the Monolith. The artifact must have entered his fathoms of ego the moment it imbued Bamboo-hatted Kim with strength.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: This manor must be... where the mentor's last protectee resided before we departed S Corp.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: Ah... such massacre...

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: Mentor, was this carnage the memory that has haunted your dreams and your waking hours for so long...?

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: Yet... the deaths of our dear fellows...
Tear begins to well in Aeng-du's eyes.
Again, something murmurs in my head.
Is this... Bamboo-hatted Kim's past?
A somber voice, drenched with woe, echoes in my head.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage Mentor
dataList.content: ... For a fleeting moment, I once had this thing people call 'honor'.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage Mentor
dataList.content: Vile men, whose hearts are consumed by evil, oft approach virtuous officials to seek harm.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage Mentor
dataList.content: And I considered it an honorable deed to be a protector of the virtuous, to hew those that sought harm against them.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage Mentor
dataList.content: Yet, to be virtuous in a world of the vicious was to be prey to this merciless world.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage Mentor
dataList.content: And before such overwhelming might of the vicious, the irrevocably corrupt officials... my strength was inconsequential.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage Mentor
dataList.content: I had little choice but to leave S Corp. cradling my broken spirit alongside my fellows.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage Mentor
dataList.content: I have left my scarred honor behind at the land of my failure.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage Mentor
dataList.content: We became vagabonds. Lost, wandering, and weary; aimless drifters without a place to call their home.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage Mentor
dataList.content: Even their faith in my decision to leave began to crumble piece by piece. So did my faith in myself.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage Mentor
dataList.content: I began to... fall apart.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage Mentor
dataList.content: I have already failed once. What's there to say that I am not failing my dear fellows once again...?

dataList.title: Blade Lineage Mentor
dataList.content: The least I could do is to help them lead a stable life...

dataList.title: Blade Lineage Mentor
dataList.content: Yet that 'invitation' I received... only led them to their demise.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage Mentor
dataList.content: In the end... I failed my mission. I failed my honor. I failed my dear fellows.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage?
dataList.content: Again, I am returned to the land of my failure...
The voice continued to murmur. But... it had devolved into nothing but a low growl, a quiet and incoherent rumbling.
I can't help but feel a bit of sympathy at his suffocatingly painful past...
... but that's exactly why we have to face him. Free him from this Distortion.
<Guys. We're putting an end to this. Right here, right now.>
Yes. It appears that we have no choice.
Aeng-du's grown far too agitated to function properly in this battle.
It's... all up to us now.
